intro: Malcolmia bungei var. lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study and garden cultivation.
